result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric K Wells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100+ costs, fees, and surcharges, to include $25 drug testing fee = $604.The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment shall result in a 30 day jail term, with Huber privileges, consecutive.
The Court requires the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

[ma] Case called at 11:27 AM 
Attorney Kayla Barteck appears.   ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Eric K Wells does NOT appear.

Atty Barteck indicates that Mr. Wells is at Crawford House in Madison, indicates he may be able to appear via zoom.
recess: 11:29am--reconvene: 11:48am

Defendant Eric K Wells now appears via zoom videoconferencing.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #2

On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100+ costs, fees, and surcharges, to include $25 drug testing fee = $604.The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment shall result in a 30 day jail term, with Huber privileges, consecutive.

The Court requires the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.
recess: 11:55am
Ok to reschedule for P & S

[ml] Case called at 1:24PM
[All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Eric K Wells appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Att De La Rosa provides an updated address for the Defendant: Beacon, 615 E Washington Ave, Madison, WI 53703

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Pleas of "Not Guilty" are entered; speedy trial is waived by the Defendant.
The Court finds probable cause to exist on the Complaint.

The Court requires a $500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription

recess 1:29PM

This case is scheduled for Initial Appearance today. 
ADA Michaels indicates that the mailing of the Summons and Complaint was not returned by the postal service.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court issues a Probable Cause Warrant-body only.
